title: Ukraine’s Advances Near Bakhmut Expose Rifts in Russian Forces
description: Russia’s pro-war bloggers were quick to claim that Ukraine’s long-anticipated counteroffensive had begun, but Ukrainian officials downplayed the advances.

title: U.S. Solar Makers Criticize Biden’s Tax Credits as Too Lax on China
description: U.S.-based manufacturers of solar products say rules issued by the Biden administration on Friday will “cement China’s dominance” over the solar industry

title: Turkey’s President Amassed Power. He Could Still Lose This Election.
description: Turkey’s president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, has tilted the political playing field in his favor over the past two decades, concentrating power in his own hands. Still, he faces a stiff challenge in Sunday’s election.

title: The Biggest Explosion in the Cosmos Just Keeps Going
description: For three years, telescopes have monitored “one of the most luminous” events ever: a supermassive black hole consuming a gigantic cloud of interstellar gas.

title: Ukraine’s Offensive Could Set Stage for Diplomacy With Russia, U.S. Officials Say
description: While exploring endgames, Biden aides say they reject any push for peace talks — including from China — that would freeze the current front lines and Russia’s gains.

title: What I’m Reading: Summer-Snobs Edition
description: Tales of status, those who have it and those who want it, are on my list.

title: Iran Releases 2 French Citizens From Detention
description: Benjamin Brière and Bernard Phelan had been accused of spying, which they denied. They had protested their captivity with hunger strikes, and their families had fought for their release.

title: China’s Economic Needs May Take a Back Seat to Security
description: Xi Jinping wants to insulate China from perceived threats from the West. He also wants to promote the country as deserving of foreign investment and clout. Can he do both?

title: Thousands of Guns Turned in After 2 Mass Shootings in Serbia
description: The unregistered weapons were handed over to the authorities as the government vows to disarm the country after two mass shootings.

title: ‘I Don’t Know What the Future Holds’: An Afghan Family at the U.S. Border
description: Hours before the end of Title 42, a family of six from Afghanistan awaited their fate at the border wall in Tijuana, Mexico, after traveling through more than a dozen countries.

title: Wendy Sherman, the Deputy Secretary of State, Plans to Retire
description: She began her first diplomatic job 30 years ago, led talks on the Iran nuclear deal and grapples with China and Russia. She is also the first woman to be deputy secretary of state.

title: Fighting Between Israel and Islamic Jihad: Here’s Where Things Stand
description: Exchanges of fire continued on Friday despite overnight mediation efforts for a cease-fire.

title: From Rap Star to Engineer to Young Mayor Demolishing Swaths of Kathmandu
description: A music idol in his early 20s and then an engineer, Balen, 33, next won an upset victory as mayor of Nepal’s capital, inspiring a wave of young politicians. Now, he’s tearing down parts of the city.

title: China Orders Tesla to Recall 1.1 Million Vehicles Over Braking Risks
description: Defects on certain Tesla models could lead drivers to step on the accelerator pedals for longer than necessary, increasing the risk of collisions, China’s market regulator says.

title: A New Round of Middle East Fighting
description: The death of an imprisoned Palestinian militant leader on a hunger strike prompted new skirmishing.

title: It’s Called Eurovision. So Why Is Australia Part of It?
description: Australia has been one of the event’s biggest markets outside Europe. Since 2015, it has been a contestant, but that may end after this year’s final.

title: China Will Send an Envoy to Russia and Ukraine to Help Negotiate an End to the War
description: Li Hui, China’s special representative for Eurasian affairs, is expected to begin his trip on Monday.

title: Chinese Dissident Sentenced to 8 Years After He Tried to Fly to His Dying Wife
description: The activist Yang Maodong said he had only wanted China to “fully realize authentic freedom, democracy, human rights and rule of law.”

title: A Crucial Question in Thailand’s Election: Can You Criticize the King?
description: Liberal voters have intensified their scrutiny of the Thai monarchy in recent years. Conservatives have responded with a campaign to defend the institution at all costs.

title: Migrants Deported to Mexico Face Criminals and Predatory Officials
description: Migrants deported by the United States to Mexico face criminal horrors and an asylum system where cases linger for years without resolution.

title: Ukraine’s Dogged Effort to Get Weapons to the Battlefield, Not the Black Market
description: They can’t track every shell, but at a time of heightened scrutiny in Washington they know they can ill afford slips with the big ticket items.

title: Once an Evangelist for Airbnbs, She Now Crusades for Affordable Housing
description: Precious Price ditched her profitable business  of renting home stays to tourists to combat the mounting housing crisis.

title: Cyclone Mocha Moves Toward Myanmar and Bangladesh
description: If current forecasts hold, the storm could be the strongest and most dangerous since 2010 to hit the area, which is the site of many refugee camps.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The timing of Ukraine’s counteroffensive.
